name: Global.Pattern.Architecture.ServiceLayer
observations: Encapsulate business logic in service classes

name: Global.Pattern.Architecture.Repository
observations: Abstract data access behind repository interface

name: Global.Pattern.Architecture.DependencyInjection
observations: Inject dependencies rather than creating them

name: Global.Pattern.ErrorHandling.CategorizedErrors
observations: Categorize errors by type for appropriate handling

name: Global.Pattern.Testing.AAA
observations: Clear separation of setup, execution, verification

name: Global.Pattern.Testing.UnitIsolation
observations: No shared state, no order dependency

name: Global.Pattern.API.RESTful
observations: Resource-based URLs, HTTP verbs for actions
GET read, POST create, PUT update, DELETE remove

name: Global.Pattern.Security.JWTAuth
observations: JSON Web Tokens for stateless authentication

name: Global.Pattern.Design.Strategy
observations: Define family of algorithms, make interchangeable
Useful for multiple implementations of same interface

name: Global.Pattern.Design.Factory
observations: Useful when creation is complex or conditional

name: Global.Pattern.Design.Observer
observations: One-to-many dependency, notify on state change

name: Global.Pattern.Code.SingleResponsibility
observations: Each class/function has one reason to change

name: Global.Pattern.Code.DRY
observations: Extract common logic to reusable functions

name: Global.Pattern.API.AsyncIO
observations: FastAPI with async database and network calls

name: Global.Pattern.API.WebSocketRealtime
observations: WebSocket for bidirectional real-time data streaming
Use for terminal sessions, live monitoring, traffic capture
Event-driven push model for immediate updates

name: Global.Pattern.API.BackgroundTasks
observations: FastAPI BackgroundTasks for async job processing
Return immediate response while processing continues

name: Global.Pattern.Network.PacketDissection
observations: Multi-layer protocol parsing from L2 to L7
Use libraries like Scapy for packet manipulation

name: Global.Pattern.Network.ServiceDiscovery
observations: Network scanning with NMAP for asset discovery
Port scanning, service detection, OS fingerprinting
Background async tasks for long-running scans

name: Global.Pattern.Frontend.StateManagement
observations: Zustand for lightweight React state management
Typed stores with clear state and action separation
Avoid prop drilling with centralized state

name: Global.Pattern.UI.CyberpunkTheme
observations: Dark theme with neon accents (green/cyan primary)
Hover effects increase opacity for interactivity

name: Global.Pattern.Knowledge.JSONL
observations: JSON Lines format for knowledge graphs

name: Global.Pattern.Testing.DockerIsolation
observations: Isolated test environments with Docker Compose
Real service containers for integration testing

name: Global.Pattern.UI.ReusableComponents
observations: Extract repeated UI patterns into reusable components
Reduces code duplication and ensures consistency

name: Global.Pattern.UI.ResponsiveGrid
observations: Use lg:grid-cols-N for desktop, single column mobile

name: Global.Pattern.Network.SourceIPValidation
observations: Track only source IPs for passive network discovery
Prevents phantom hosts from destination tracking
Filter invalid IPs: 0.0.0.0, broadcast, multicast, link-local

name: Global.Pattern.Documentation.DecisionTracking
observations: Document all decisions with chosen and rejected alternatives
Include rationale for choices and reasons for rejections
Use decision diagrams for complex workflows

name: Global.Pattern.DevOps.DockerCacheManagement
observations: Nuclear cleanup protocol for persistent caching issues
Apply after 2nd failed rebuild to prevent wasted attempts
Prevents code changes from being invisible in containers

name: Global.Pattern.Development.IncrementalValidation
observations: Build/test after each file change, not batch at end
Enables quick isolation of which change caused failure
Reduces debugging time from minutes to seconds

name: Global.Pattern.Architecture.DecisionMinimalism
observations: Document main choice + primary alternative only
Reduces cognitive overhead and speeds workflow
Focus on actionable rationale, not exhaustive analysis
